DOC.brief_title: A Multi-Center Study Rehabilitation Stable Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD ) Patients
DOC.detailed_description: This multi-center prospective follow-up study.More 20 hospital participate research . More 300 stable COPD patient recruited.It two-year study . There four group , cycle walk group ( C-WG ) , cycle non-walking group ( C-nonWG ) , walk walk group ( W-WG ) , walk non-walking group ( W-nonWG ) . 1 . All patient four group finish baseline investigation blood sample , include informed consent , questionaires ( SGRQ , CRDQ , MRCQ , Depression Scale , etc . ) , spirometry,6MWT , MIP , MEP , BMI , CRP , TNF , IL-8 , etc.Patients C-WG C-nonWG finish cardiopulmonary test . 2 . Patients receive 8 week train program , include upper low extremity endurance exercise respiratory muscle endurance exercise . Patients CGs cycle cycle ergometry . Patients W-WG W-nonWG walking instead . All patient receive train program twice per year , two year . Patients supervise physician nurse hospital training . 3 . In non-training period , patient W-WG C-WG continue walk community , supervise nurse call every month . The two group ( C-nonWG W-nonWG ) receive special requirement exercise . 4 . Telephone call interview give patient every month find whether acute exacerbation . Patients ask record activity daytime diary card . 5 . All patient finish investigation blood sample one year two year , include questionaires , spirometry,6MWT , MIP , MEP , BMI , CRP , TNF , IL-8 , etc.Patients CG finish cardiopulmonary test .
DOC.criteria: accord GOLD , patient diagnose COPD , lung function II III grade ( II:50 % ≤FEV1＜60 % pre；III:30 % ≤FEV1＜50 % pre）； 40≤age≤75 year old； n't acute exacerbation past one month； SpO2 > 88 % rest； diabetes , blood glucose n't control well ; vascular disease ( vasculitis , deep venous thrombosis , varicose vein , etc ) ; joint disease may affect activity ; cerebrovascular disease may affect activity ; unstable angina past 1 month acute myocardial infarction past 6 month ; severe arrhythmia ; cardia insufficiency ; hypertension n't control well ( systolic pressure > 160mmHg and/or diastolic pressure > 100mmHg ) ; chronic liver renal insufficiency ; cognitive handicap .
